Better textbooks should be provided in both parts of the course. For the first part I felt that MWG was not the most appropriate textbook. MWG would be great for the second part of the course. The book used in the second part is very difficult to read because of its notation and its many typos.

The strength is that the lectures cover both very individual factors (e.g. choice theory) and macro analyses (e.g. general equilibrium theory) that provide not only solid analytical tools but also chances to think about assumptions behind economic analysis and whether/how/when they are appropriate or need modifications. This will help me conduct researches in subsequent years.
The homeworks were very useful and the exams felt reasonable.  It would be useful if Truman used slides or gave out lecture notes.
